meanings.definition: To block or obstruct the flow of water by building a dam.
meanings.sent1: The beavers dammed the stream to create a pond.
meanings.sent2: The workers dammed the river to control flooding.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dammed the sink with too many dishes.
meanings.sent4: Her tears dammed up behind her eyes, ready to burst.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree dammed the creek, causing it to overflow.

meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier to express strong feelings of anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: Dammed! I forgot my keys again.
meanings.sent2: Oh dammed! The traffic is so bad today.
meanings.sent3: Dammed! I spilled my drink all over the table.
meanings.sent4: The dammed computer crashed right before I saved my work.
meanings.sent5: Well, dammed if I'm going to let this ruin my day.
